Key Match Events: Draymond Green was assessed a flagrant foul for tripping Memphis’ Zach Edey.
Steve Kerr picked up a late technical foul.
Draymond Green drew an ejection late in the 4th quarter.
Draymond Green received a technical foul for complaining about a foul call on Moses Moody.
Draymond Green managed to get his second technical foul and an ejection from the bench after he was subbed out.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Taylor Jenkins complained about Green’s dirty play after the game.
Steve Kerr expressed frustration over the game turning into a 'parade to the free throw line'.
Draymond Green's actions were compared to a similar incident involving Domantas Sabonis in the 2023 playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was out of reach, but the two points lost to technical free throws might affect the Warriors in the Emirates Cup due to point differential being the tiebreaker.
Draymond Green's flagrant foul will result in a fine of at least $6,000.
Green is now at four technical fouls for the 2024-25 season, tied with Jayson Tatum for the league lead.
Green is at 154 technical fouls for his career, just two behind Carmelo Anthony for 15th place in NBA history.
